verb.description: Say something again or a number of times, typically for emphasis or clarity.
examples: she reiterated that the administration would remain steadfast in its support
“I just want to forget it all,” he reiterated
he reiterated the points made in his earlier speech

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense do an action repeatedly): from Latin reiterat- gone over again, from the verb reiterare, from re- again + iterare do a second time.
